data.title: Travel to Germany withouth Leaving Lakewood
data.text: After living in Germany for five years, nothing makes me more sentimental than a quick walk through Hess Bakery and Deli!  The smells, the ladies chattering in German, the packaging (also auf Deutsch) are a much less expensive way to celebrate all things German than a round-trip ticket.  Of course, if you're like me, you can spend a small fortune picking up a "few things" for your next German meal.  Pretzel and Kaiser rolls, a couple of pounds of Gelbwurst and Bierkugel, and of course -- brats and rindswurst,

data.title: Good European foods albeit slightly overpriced
data.text: I love to go to this bakery and deli when I have the money to pay more than market prices. for example, their German brotchen rolls are $1 apiece. I get Mexican rolls that are bigger  but similar in taste and texture for 55 cents at Albertson.  They have many flavors of meats that I like but again quite expensive.  I bought 8 German sausages and was surprised they charged be $25.  Also  they have several selections of liverwurst or braunsweiger but about $11 pound and pay 3.99 at Albertson's or Cash & Carry and like those much better because of the savings.

data.title: german barker
data.text: Enjoyed there baked goods . We bought a lot and shared with everyone. I didn't due a pie but if I go back will try cheese cake great. They also have a deli and had great meats and cheese. I would go back

data.title: A blast from the past
data.text: My family is from Germany and I totally enjoy being able to go to Hess Deli to get my favorite lunchmeats and breads.  I have not purchased anything from the bakery, since I'm trying to keep my weight down, but it all looks fantastic.

data.title: Best German Bakery around!!
data.text: German deli, sides and fresh baked treats ..   Great place to stop in grab a coffee and sit down with a slice of cake or strusel ..... Pretzel Rolls are fresh and absoulety delish

data.title: german bakery
data.text: read that it was a German Bakery... they had a large assortment of German products... The deli looked very appealing

data.title: A real treat.
data.text: This hidden specialty bakery and deli is a highlight in Lakewood and the surrounding area.  The bakery offers several kinds of breads and rolls but they are famous for their cakes and pastries.  An added treat is the deli offering many kinds of deli meats, sandwiches and German groceries.  The bakery offers a place to sit down and eat a slice of cake and coffee.

data.title: All the right food!
data.text:
If you want German grocery favorites, traditional deli meats, and even some beers that most stores don't stock, you know who you are. You should shop here. We may not learn to make Knoeffle like my gramma, but we can buy the good packaged stuff here!  
If you ever visited, served in, or lived in Germany, you will wish you could walk here for fresh bread daily, just like the old country.

data.title: A wonderful bakery
data.text: I have been to this bakery many of times, the fresh baked pretzels are absolutely divine! I have purchased many of their pretzels and shared them with others, they are fresh with just the right amount of crunch to them.

data.title: German Deli
data.text: I go here all the time for the German Deli foods, and German bottled beers. I have also had the strudel from the bakery and its all very good!

data.title: Authentic German Food
data.text: We love getting fresh rye bread at Hess Bakery. They also have a huge selection of cheeses and meats. People there are always nice, they usually have a piece of candy for my grandchildren.

data.title: Delight for Germans and Americans
data.text: Had enjoyed Hess' rolls and pretzels previously when a local store used to carry them.  When a friend moved to the area from Germany, I thought it would be fun to visit the store.  It was a paradise for food and beer selection and the employees speak German.  Everyone is very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable.  They make fresh sandwiches to order and have a small eating area there.  Can't wait to return!

data.title: Great place to feel like you've traveled to Germany
data.text: I have come to Hess Bakery to buy German brotchen and bread, Deli meats and cheeses, and lots of other great items like German pickles, sauerkraut, jam, honey, mustard, chocolate and much more plus on the other side of the Bakery is a coffee shop which serves delicious homemade soup, sandwiches, and German cakes and pastries.

data.title: Authentic German Pretzels!
data.text: The Hess Bakery and Deli is always a waypoint on my driving trips from Seattle to Portland. Sometimes I dine in, but most often I buy a few pretzels and pretzel rolls for the driving trip south. Best pretzels in the Pacific Northwest, I say!

data.title: Taste of Deutschland
data.text: Very authentic food the meats are wonderful they have a very good selection of dry cured meats also salami and landjaeger, try the garlic pepper corn bologna its top notch.

data.title: hows your german?
data.text: the bread smells good. the deli can make you a great sandwich. buy a pretzel stick or some rolls. this is all good and its all fresh.

data.title: Consistently a Favorite!
data.text:
We've been coming to the European Square for years to eat and buy authentic foodstuffs.  Our kids love the pastries, pies, cakes, and sandwiches on the cafe side and we love the reasonable prices as well.  It's our go-to place when we aren't sure what we want for breakfast or lunch.

The deli and bakery on the opposite is superb as well.  While the prices are a little high for the deli and most items on the shelves, the daily made breads, pretzels and rolls are to die for!  I just can't stay away from this place!

data.title: Yum!!
data.text:
This store, located in the European Square, is a must for Germans or German food lovers. The fresh breads, rolls (broetchen) and other baked goods are very good. The deli is small, but has decent basic selections. They'll make fresh sandwiches for you (belegte Broetchen) Lots of German specialties, i.e. sauce mixes, goods in can and jars. Some refrigerated items like Pickled herring in cream sauce (Yum..) German magazines also available.
The coffee shop has a good German cake and other sweets selection. The coffee though lacks the flavor of good German coffee.

data.title: Good and simple German lunch and dessert
data.text: I love this place. A favorite for just a simple lunch, usually sandwich & soup, and German pastry to finish it off. All the staff are friendly and they all seem to speak both German and English. If anyone misses pastry or cakes from Germany that are not too sweet then this is the place.

data.title: Love EVERYTHING
data.text: You have to come here if you want the best pastry. Everything is so good. Love their pie, pretzels and just about everything. Always fresh and the staff is so nice.
